GENERIC_NO_DISPLAYS: No displays detected. Please connect a display to your PC.
GENERIC_NO_COMPATIBLE_DISPLAYS: No compatible displays found. Please check that "DDC/CI" is enabled for your displays.
INTRO_INSTRUCTIONS: The tray icon for Twinkle Tray is probably hidden, so you should move it to some place you can easily access it. See below for instructions.
SETTINGS_GENERAL_BRIGHTNESS_STARTUP_DESC: Restore the last known brightness for each display when Twinkle Tray starts.
SETTINGS_GENERAL_RESET_DESC: Hit this button to clear your config.
SETTINGS_GENERAL_ACRYLIC_DESC: Enable or disable the blur behind transparent backgrounds in Twinkle Tray.
SETTINGS_GENERAL_ANALYTICS_DESC: Send usage data to help improve Twinkle Tray. No personal info is sent. {{1}}
SETTINGS_GENERAL_SCROLL_DESC: Adjust the brightness of all displays at once by scrolling over the system tray icon. This does not work with some trackpads.
SETTINGS_MONITORS_RATE_DESC: How often the brightness will be updated on your displays as you're adjusting their values. Increase the time if your displays are flickering.
SETTINGS_MONITORS_RENAME_DESC: If you'd prefer a different name for each monitor (ex "Left Monitor", "Middle Monitor"), you can enter it below. Leaving the field empty will restore the original name.
SETTINGS_MONITORS_REORDER_DESC: Change the order that monitors are displayed in the tray. Click and drag to make changes.
SETTINGS_MONITORS_NORMALIZE_DESC: Monitors often have different brightness ranges. By limiting the min/max brightness per display, the brightness levels between displays is much more consistent. Similar monitors will use the same settings.
SETTINGS_FEATURES_DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable specific DDC/CI features in the brightness panel. At least one feature must be enabled for your monitor to show up in the brightness panel. Not all displays support these features, such as laptop/tablet displays.
SETTINGS_TIME_DESC: Automatically set your monitors to a specific brightness level at a desired time. All monitors will be set to the same, normalized levels.
SETTINGS_TIME_INDIVIDUAL_DESC: Configure the brightness per display instead of for all displays at once.
SETTINGS_TIME_STARTUP_DESC: Adjust the brightness to match the most relevant time when Twinkle Tray starts.
SETTINGS_HOTKEYS_DESC: Configure hotkeys to adjust the brightness of one or all displays.
SETTINGS_HOTKEYS_LEVEL_DESC: How much the brightness should be adjusted when using hotkeys.
SETTINGS_HOTKEYS_TOD_DESC: Customize the signal sent when using the Turn Off Displays hotkey or icon. The software signal will display a black screen until input (ex. mouse or keyboard) is detected by Windows. The hardware signal will turn off power to the monitors.
SETTINGS_HOTKEYS_TOD_NOTE: *Note: Not all DDC/CI monitors support this feature.
SETTINGS_HOTKEYS_BREAK_DESC: When using a hotkey for a single display and "linked levels" is active, it will be deactivated.
SETTINGS_UPDATES_AUTOMATIC_DESC: When there is a new version, it will be shown in the brightness panel.
SETTINGS_UPDATES_MS_STORE: To check for new versions, visit the Microsoft Store app.
SETTINGS_UPDATES_AVAILABLE: New version of Twinkle Tray available!
SETTINGS_UPDATES_NONE_AVAILABLE: Up to date. The current version includes the following changes:
